item.title: Level-4 player with fire cape
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I james I:

its not a jagex staff, its was possible when the eating glitch was existant, for example, if you ate just before you got hit, you wouldnt die, so you’d stack up on purple sweets and use recoils to kill Jad.

Or if you read his adventurers log it said something like “I just got 71 range”.

item.title: Level-4 player with fire cape
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:22, topic:367435”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=463599.msg3394369#msg3394369 date=1289195389]

But not a deterrent, since you lose nothing but time whereas with a ban you lose your main.

I think a stats reset is a lot more of ‘losing your main’ than a ban, but maybe that’s just me.
[/quote]
I disagree with this, If I had my stats reset after being banned for using aryan I would of continued playing probably up until the point they destroyed unbalanced trading and pking. I enjoyed the game I tried playing on a new character but it was not the same. The friends and connections you make on one account can never be the same after you have to tell them you are playing on a new name because you were banned.[/quote]

That’s an excellent point. I guess it just comes down to whatever main focus one has for playing the game in the first place.

Read full topic

item.title: Level-4 player with fire cape
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:21, topic:367435”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=463599.msg3393813#msg3393813 date=1289157772]
But not a deterrent, since you lose nothing but time whereas with a ban you lose your main.
[/quote]

I think a stats reset is a lot more of ‘losing your main’ than a ban, but maybe that’s just me.[/quote]
I disagree with this, If I had my stats reset after being banned for using aryan I would of continued playing probably up until the point they destroyed unbalanced trading and pking. I enjoyed the game I tried playing on a new character but it was not the same. The friends and connections you make on one account can never be the same after you have to tell them you are playing on a new name because you were banned.

Read full topic

item.title: Level-4 player with fire cape
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:15, topic:367435”][quote author=BloodRayne link=topic=463599.msg3393384#msg3393384 date=1289140211]

Surprised they’ve even started this back again.

I’m not. It’s obvious that people weren’t learning before. “My account is going to be banned for 10 days? That’s cool. I’ll just come back to a maxed out botted account.” - This is no longer the attitude towards it. Now, it’s more of something like this - “Shit, they’re rolling back levels now? I can’t bot on my main.”
[/quote]… Or they just permaban accounts 100% of the time, and people won’t bot their mains, simple as that.[/quote]

Even permanent bans have the small chance of becoming nonpermanent and even being reversed one day. Rolling back is irreversible, no matter what. Plus it’s kind of a tease to the botters, in my opinion.

Read full topic
